page.title: 18FARMS IN BLOCK 02440105
page.content: There are about 20 widely scattered farms in the block; half are under 100 acres. Half are dairy farms, the rest keeping sheep, pigs and beef cattle. The largest,with 750 acres, is exclusively devoted to corn. Most have remained unchanged in their field layout for many years, though the largest has removed a number of hedges for greater efficiency.About half have replaced or added to farm buildings in recent years and all own tractors and modern machinery. Several have small areas of established woodland, with oak, ash, beech, sycamore and hazel, and 2 have newly planted areas of broad-leafed trees. One farmhouse includes a carved church beam and a wall plaque dated 1708 while another stands on the site of a monastery. About half the farmers expect their sons to run the farm when they retire.
